page.title: 09Landscaping in Darwen
page.content: Between Priory Drive and Pole Lane there is about 4 acres of spare land. Last year the diggers came and turned all the land over.Pathways were made and all the land was seeded with grass.Rows and rows of young trees were planted ,some are willows,some are birch and a lot of other kinds. When they were planted they were about 50 cms tall and in 12 months they have grown to about 1metre. Part of the land at one side is just grass and has been levelled out to be used as a football pitch.On the pathways there are benches for people to sit in and rest.There is a litte pond in the middle.At the bottom end of the area is St.Peter's school.
